answers.answer: What was your serum calcium results with range?Yes EDTA can drain you of a lot of your vitamins and minerals....were you on any supplements or have you taken any since???  EDTA can also be rough on your kidneys.Numbness and tingling in hands and feet is neuropathy and can be caused by several things: thyroid disease, low B12 levels, diabetes, etc.What were your most recent lab results with ranges for your thyroid, PTH, and calcium?

Vitamin D can be lowered by other hormones - for instance, cortisol. And that can cause fatigue, osteoporosis. pain, and the memory issues. It also causes depression. It also depresses the thyroid.So it may not be PTH, but another hormone, or another cause entirely.Have you had all your hormones checked?

question: Is it possible to have parathroid disease if your serum calcium and PTH are normal. For 4 years I have had a low Vit D  and even while taking 50,000 units a week my level is 21. I also have bone problems and my teeth are slowly dissolving away. I have unbearable joint pain (arthryalgias) and myalgia, tinnitus, bedridden often due to fatigue, difficulty concentrating and poor memory. All this has caused depression especially since I'm basically alone with no friend or family support. A year ago I started  CaEDTA IV therapy and hyperbaric oxygen therapy which helped some of my memory problems but not any other improvement and what seems like an increased numbness and tingling in my hands and feet. The serum calcium was done recently and I wondered if the chelation therapy had lowered the calcium level which in turn effected the PTH level. I also take Synthroid for Hypothroidism and had ovarian cancer in 1981. Please someone help me. I know others have worse problems but I can't stand the pain any more.
title: Diagnosing Parathroid Disease
